subsection.title: Solving Inequalities Graphically
subsection.p: In , we used linear regression to fit a line to a collection of data points. If the data points do not cluster around a line, it does not make sense to describe them by a linear function. Compare the scatterplots in . The points in a are roughly linear in appearance, but the points in b are not. However, we can visualize a parabola that would approximate the data we will. In this section, we will see how to fit a quadratic function to a collection of data points.
We will need to solve a special type of 3 \times 3 linear system, that is, a linear system of three equations in three variables. We can solve these systems using the elimination method.
